TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit IISVirtualRoot extends System.Object implements class System.EnterpriseServices.Internal.IComSoapIISVRoot

Docs.summary: Creates and deletes Internet Information Services (IIS) 6.0 virtual roots.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.Internal.IComSoapIISVRoot> interface defines methods for creating and deleting virtual roots in IIS 6.0.
This interface is implemented only by the <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.Internal.IISVirtualRoot> class and is used only within the .NET Framework infrastructure while creating a SOAP-enabled COM+ application virtual root.
<xref:System.EnterpriseServices.Internal.IComSoapIISVRoot> does not need to be implemented directly in your code. Instead, use the <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.Internal.Publish> class, which implements the <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.Internal.IComSoapPublisher> interface that contains the <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.Internal.IComSoapPublisher.CreateVirtualRoot%2A> and <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.Internal.IComSoapPublisher.DeleteVirtualRoot%2A> methods. However, <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.Internal.IComSoapPublisher.DeleteVirtualRoot%2A> is not fully implemented by <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.Internal.Publish>.
<xref:System.EnterpriseServices.Internal.IISVirtualRoot> is used internally by the .NET Framework. You do not need to use it directly in your code.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Create (string RootWeb, string inPhysicalDirectory, string VirtualDirectory, out string Error);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Create(string RootWeb, string inPhysicalDirectory, string VirtualDirectory, [out] string& Error) cil managed
Public Sub Create (RootWeb As String, inPhysicalDirectory As String, VirtualDirectory As String, ByRef Error As String)
public: virtual void Create(System::String ^ RootWeb, System::String ^ inPhysicalDirectory, System::String ^ VirtualDirectory, [Runtime::InteropServices::Out] System::String ^ % Error);
abstract member Create : string * string * string * -> unit override this.Create : string * string * string * -> unit

Docs.param: A string with the value "IIS://localhost/W3SVC/1/ROOT" representing the root Web server.
The physical path of the virtual root, which corresponds to PhysicalPath from the method.
The name of the virtual root, which corresponds to VirtualRoot from .
A string to which an error message can be written.
Docs.summary: Creates an Internet Information Services (IIS) virtual root.

remarks.format: ## Remarks You do not need to call the <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.Internal.IISVirtualRoot.Create%2A> method from your code. Instead, use the <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.Internal.Publish.CreateVirtualRoot%2A> method.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Delete (string RootWeb, string PhysicalDirectory, string VirtualDirectory, out string Error);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Delete(string RootWeb, string PhysicalDirectory, string VirtualDirectory, [out] string& Error) cil managed
Public Sub Delete (RootWeb As String, PhysicalDirectory As String, VirtualDirectory As String, ByRef Error As String)
public: virtual void Delete(System::String ^ RootWeb, System::String ^ PhysicalDirectory, System::String ^ VirtualDirectory, [Runtime::InteropServices::Out] System::String ^ % Error);
abstract member Delete : string * string * string * -> unit override this.Delete : string * string * string * -> unit

Docs.param: The root Web server, as specified by RootWebServer from the method.
The physical path of the virtual root.
The name of the virtual root.
A string to which an error message can be written.
Docs.summary: Deletes an Internet Information Services (IIS) virtual root.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Even though it is public, the <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.Internal.IISVirtualRoot.Delete%2A> method is not intended to be called directly.
Alternatively, there is the <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.Internal.Publish.DeleteVirtualRoot%2A> method. However, this method is not fully implemented.
